lines.text: If you're trying to get on my good side, forget it. I haven't got one.
Lead's gonna fly. I can feel it in my bones. If I should catch one, boys, promise me you'll bury me where I fall.
[first lines]
Put the gun down John Henry.
[last lines]
Look, a Texas train.
Aren't you a little old to go running around chasing an outlaw?
Well, ain't he a little old to go running around robbing banks?
A man who don't know the ropes is liable to get one around his neck.
Outlawin' ain't what it used to be.
It never was, John Henry.
Fire at will.
Who?

I guess I'll never get used to it. they're brought in here ramrod straight, arrogant, ready to tackle the world. And they walk away broken down old men. Nowhere to go, nothing to do, and too wore out to do it if even if there was.
You see, I don't have a good side either.
You'll have the spent the rest of your lives knowing you killed 5 men.
5 old men. Makes a difference.
You made a mistake.
I sure did, 20 years ago. I should have shot him.
Wagon headed south, four outriders, three empty horses.
Hey Jason, I take back everything I ever said against you. You're as good a tracker as you ever were, being able to hear all that just by putting your ear to the ground.
I didn't hear anything, they just ran over me.
You wanna have a shootout?
That's right.
Sounds kind of old fashioned.
Claire? No, that goes with a redhead. Bertha? No, that goes with a cow. Kitty. Gotta be that.
For two cents I'd throw the keys in the water bucket and ride out of here.
On what?
Look old man, I set out to spend that gold, and that's what I full intend to do.
What a man intends and what he does is sometimes different.
There's a town up ahead!
That town up ahead has been there for the last half hour.
It has?
Jason Fitch, you are the worst tracker I ever did see.
I spent 20 years up there in that prison planning day and night, living on vengeance, hate, and pride, and it's all come down to one rusty spike.
